description: Strengthening capacities in the Western Balkans countries to address environmental problems through remediation of high priority hot spots

subproject.description: Strengthened regional co-operation in the Western Balkans regarding hot spots remediation
subproject.gender code: No noticeable contribution to gender equality
subproject.title: Regional Activities and Progra

subproject.description: The project aims at enhancing capacities for good environmental management at local and national level, securing significant progress in mitigation of negative impact of the mining operations and increasing the public awareness on issues related t environmental hot spots. The main intervention focuse on the clean up and remediation, demonstration and information sharing.
subproject.gender code: No noticeable contribution to gender equality
subproject.title: Macedonia - Hot Spot Project

subproject.description:
Achieve improvement of environmental situation and quality of life for citizens living in and around polluted areas through least cost measures, improved local and national policy dialogue and supply of domestic professional services in the environmental management sector. 
•	Secure progress in clean-up and remediation of Bajza hotspot, 
•	Enhanced regional co-operation through improved information sharing progress and supply of professional consultancy services regarding good environmental management

subproject.title: Montenegro- Hot Spot Project

subproject.description:
1. Remediation of Stan Trg/Stari Trg and Novo Brdo/Artana mines
Indicative activities:
o	Site selection (ENVSEC sites)
o	Memorandum of Understandings  for each hotspot with municipal authorities, MEM, MESP and Trepca
o	Action plan for clean up 
o	Remediation work  (initiated within the first 6 months of the project, completed within the second year to allow for evaluation and dissemination of results)
o	Transfer of on-the-ground investment, know-how and institutional capacities to local stakeholders to ensure a controlled hand-over  
o	Technical training courses for Trepca employees to support efficient implementation of, and follow-up to, environmental remediation activities
o	Evaluation and dissemination of results, including a documentary (implemented by local NGO) of the hotspots describing the initial situation, project efforts and achieved results
o	Establishment of a local community network of all hotspots under the umbrella programme (to meet every 6 months) to present and discuss the results of clean-up projects or other activities and problems relevant to all members

 2: Demonstration and information sharing through policy integration
Indicative Activities:
o	Assessment of policy integration mechanisms and practice at the national and local level 
o	2 week intensive seminar on environmental economics and policy integration – including the promotion of access to information and linking to Environmental Impact Assessment (EIA) and Strategic Environment Assessment (SEA) as mechanisms to implement policy recommendations
o	Seminar participants will be required to undertake pilot projects of policy integration, using the clean-up sites as case studies
o	Participation in three regional meetings on sustainable environmental management

 3: Improving capacities of local environmental professionals
Indicative Activities
o	Market survey of professional environmental services in Kosovo
o	Establishment of a roster of qualified environmental experts
o	1 week seminar on sustainable development in the mining, energy and industrial sectors
o	Creation of an e-based sustainable development practitioners network, with funds for activities and at least 4 studies on sustainable development related to mining, energy, industrial and economic sectors in Kosovo.
subproject.title: Kosovo- Hot Spot Project
